oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter from Private James M. (J.W.) Warren to Miss Nancy Hayes
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Letter refers to being at Fort Donaldson (sic) and not being pleased with his "home." ' Talks about looking for the "yankeys" and having "4 thousand men here besides our battalion." Directs returning responses to "Major Combs (sic) Battallion in care of Capt. M.T. Martain's Company. Warren served in the 1st Battalion, Tennessee Infantry (Colms').This is one of a series of wartime letters from soldier friends and prospective beaus to the popular Miss Hayes of McMinnville.
